2012-12-27
09:36		 The order Rodentia in South America / Charles Darwin
The order Rodentia is here very numerous in species: of mice alone I obtained no less than eight kinds. 1The largest gnawing animal in the world, the Hydrochærus capybara (the water-hog), is here also common. One which I shot at Monte Video weighed ninety-eight pounds: its length, from the end of the snout to the stump-like tail, was three feet two inches; and its girth three feet eight [...] test fr
